opts.opt: Foundations Features used as footings for structures, such as linear features made from wood, brick, stone or compacted sediment, or raised/levelled features providing a demarcated floor (e.g. raised earthen floor, concrete pad)
Standing structure Any historic structure that is still standing, more than 50% intact, and whose original form and fabric is easily discerned
Walls or posts Any historic wall or remnants thereof, both collapsed or standing, including associated gates, posts or entrances
Fences Any historic fence, collapsed or standing, including associated gates, posts or entrances
Landscaping Modification of the original land surface for any purpose
Plantings Areas used for planting of edible or ornamental species (orchards, gardens)
Rubble Assemblage of construction material (e.g. brick, stone, wood, concrete) associated with a collapsed structure or building
Discard area Areas or features used for intentional discard of refuse (privy pits, incinerators, rubbish areas)
Well Intentionally constructed feature, typically lined, and used for retrieving water
Water management Features associated with capture, movement or storage of water (weir, pipeline, canals, tank)
Roads and tracks Features, typically linear, associated with transportation of people, stock or goods (e.g. historic track, pathway, raised road)
Mining Features assocaited with mining activities (stamp head, davit trench, associated structures and buildings)
Machinery Objects or structures that are mechanical in nature (e.g. abandoned vehicle, wrecked plane, mining equipment)
Burials Evidence of burials (single or multiple)
Wharf or landing Features used for landing, loading and unloading vessels. Can be built structures or modified landscape
Other Use annotation field to describe
